name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

key_work.title: Dream a Little Crazy – Architecture in Helsinki [exhibition video]
key_work.brief_description: Renowned for their colourful and crazy videos, Architecture in Helsinki’s clip for Dream A Little Crazy (2013) is no exception. A collaboration between body architect Lucy McRae and designer Rachel Wingfield, the music video presents a “biological bakery” as it creates an edible anatomy.

constellations_primary.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_primary.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

start.title: Cyberpunk 2077
start.brief_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is a role-playing video game developed and published by CD Projekt. Adapted from the Cyberpunk franchise, the game is an open world, non-linear RPG with an FPS style in which players are able to heavily customize their character to suit their play style. Gun play, exploration, player choice and activities such as hacking are to feature heavily throughout the game with missions, quests and objectives being completed in a variety of different ways. The world will have dynamic weather and a day/night cycle to make it truly immersive.

links.description: Performance and body artist Stelarc has had a long career investigating “alternate anatomical architectures” or the relationship between the body and technology through human/machine interfaces. His mechanical prostheses extending the possibilities and limits of the body and science.

end.title: Ex Machina
end.brief_description: A young coder wins a competition to spend a week at a private mountain retreat belonging to the world’s largest internet company’s reclusive CEO. But when he arrives, Caleb has to participate in an experiment involving the world’s first true AI.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_other.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

constellations_other.name: Robots, robots everywhere
constellations_other.description: Steampunk aesthetics, malevolent AI and cybernetic cops push the frontiers of imagination in this Constellation inspired by Dishonored 2.

constellations_other.name: Femme fatales to fembots
constellations_other.description: When women gain power, men get scared. You can see this in the mysterious, seductive and deadly femme fatale. Using her sexuality and intellect to manipulate, control and co-opt power, the femme fatale reflects prevailing attitudes to women.

links.description: Examining the robotic experiments of tech genius Nathan Bateman, programmer Caleb is brought in to administer the Turing Test to Bateman’s humanoid protype Ava. While determining if Ava is truly self-aware or a perfect simulation, Calab discovers Bateman’s dark ulterior motives.

end.title: Westworld

video_links.name: Westworld - Official Trailer - Warner Bros. UK

end.brief_description: A dark odyssey about the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin, set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, Westworld explores a world in which every human appetite, noble or depraved, can be indulged.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: Similarly exploring the confluence of human consciousness and artificial technology Westworld too uses the Turning Test as a means to confirm fidelity amongst the copied robot humanoids. For the central characters in the park, the next stage of human evolution lies in their emancipated digital code.

end.title: Gattaca
end.creator_credit: Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher, Jersey Films, Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures, Colleen Atwood, Andrew Niccol, Jan Roelfs and Janek Sirrs
end.brief_description: In a future society in the era of indefinite eugenics, humans are set on a life course depending on their DNA. Young Vincent Freeman is born with a condition that would prevent him from space travel, yet is determined to infiltrate the GATTACA space program.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

links.description: Biopunk science fiction film Gattaca examines the grim possibilities of genetic engineering. In a future where society is dictated by eugenics and children are conceived through genetic selection, Vincent Freeman goes to extreme lengths to hide his natural origins and chromosomal inferiority.

start.title: Gattaca
start.creator_credit: Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher, Jersey Films, Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures, Colleen Atwood, Andrew Niccol, Jan Roelfs and Janek Sirrs

end.title: Cyberpunk 2077
end.brief_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is a role-playing video game developed and published by CD Projekt. Adapted from the Cyberpunk franchise, the game is an open world, non-linear RPG with an FPS style in which players are able to heavily customize their character to suit their play style. Gun play, exploration, player choice and activities such as hacking are to feature heavily throughout the game with missions, quests and objectives being completed in a variety of different ways. The world will have dynamic weather and a day/night cycle to make it truly immersive.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

links.description: Open-world, action-adventure Cyberpunk 2077 takes place in the future megalopolis of Night City, where body modification has dramatically altered the way its inhabitants live. Cyberware implants and customisation shape the narrative, as outlaw V attempts to find the one-of-a-kind upgrade for immortality.
